column4: hi. i'm having some problems booting kubuntu. i boot my computer, i see the grub thing, i choose kubuntu, it starts loading and then i get this error message " Buffer I/O error on device hda1, logical block" and a couple of numbers. after, it tells me "/dev/hda1 contains a file system with errors, check forced" and it gives me the same buffer thing again. does anyone know how to fix this and could help me please?
looks like your harddisk has a problem. Boot the CD and look at it from there
to be honest... tht message could mean your hd got belly up already
why dont you just boot up the Desktop -CD, look at hda1 if there's still something on it, and in case there is, unmout it and run a fsck on that drive?
time to look for the backups
this drive is apparently toast.... if you discover you're riding a dead horse, unmount
